meanings.sent1: My cymbling and I share a room.
meanings.sent2: I love playing with my cymbling in the park.
meanings.sent3: My cymbling always steals my snacks!
meanings.sent4: Having a cymbling is like having a built-in best friend.
meanings.sent5: Growing up with a cymbling means never feeling alone.

meanings.definition: To act as a sibling towards someone.
meanings.sent1: I cymble my younger cousin when we play together.
meanings.sent2: She always cymbles her classmates by sharing her toys.
meanings.sent3: Let's cymble each other and work as a team!
meanings.sent4: In times of need, it's important to cymble those around you.
meanings.sent5: The older students like to cymble the new ones to help them settle in.

meanings.definition: A person who is related to another by having one or both parents in common.
meanings.sent1: My cymbling and I have the same parents.
meanings.sent2: She is my cymbling because we share a parent.
meanings.sent3: Being a cymbling means always having someone to share memories with.
meanings.sent4: We may not always agree, but my cymbling will always have my back.
meanings.sent5: Growing up with a cymbling means having a partner in crime for life.
